title: BONUS: The Lasting Power Of Whitney Houston's National Anthem
description:
Why does Whitney Houston's 1991 Super Bowl national anthem still resonate 30 years later? In this episode of NPR's It's Been A Minute, host Sam Sanders chats with author Danyel Smith about that moment of Black history and what it says about race, patriotism and pop culture.

Smith wrote about the significance of that national anthem performance back in 2016 for ESPN.

Listen to more episodes of It's Been A Minute on Apple Podcasts and Spotify.

itunes:title: BONUS: The Lasting Power Of Whitney Houston's National Anthem
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Just like today, with a nation on edge from the pandemic and politics, the 1991 Super Bowl was set against a fraught moment in US history.
itunes:subtitle: Just like today, with a nation on edge from the pandemic and politics, the 1991 Super Bowl was set against a fraught moment in US history.
